<p><strong>Curcumin:</strong> yellow pigment found in turmeric. Acts as a natural antioxidant and anti-inflammatory.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?script=Console&source=https://bioquanti.netlify.app/pt/nivel/basico/jardim/betacaroteno.png">
  <img src="bcaroteno.png" alt="Betacaroteno" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Beta-carotene:</strong> orange pigment found in carrots. It is a precursor to vitamin A and important for vision and immunity.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?script=Console&source=https://bioquanti.netlify.app/en/nivel/basico/jardim/licopeno.png">
  <img src="licopeno.png" alt="Licopeno" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Lycopene:</strong> red pigment found in tomatoes. Acts as an antioxidant, helping to protect cells.</p>

<a href="https://chemapps.stolaf.edu/jmol/jmol.php?script=Console&source=https://bioquanti.netlify.app/en/nivel/basico/jardim/clorofila.png">
  <img src="clorofila.png" alt="Clorofila" style="max-width: 150px; height: auto;">
</a>
<p><strong>Chlorophyll:</strong> green pigment found in plants, essential for photosynthesis. It also has antioxidant and detoxifying properties.</p>
